message: Created optimized version of AmoebaMultipoleForce kernels when all quadrupoles are 0
Personal commit to make modeller easier to use
Workarounds for devices whose maximum workgroup size varies between kernels
Bug fix to selecting workgroup size for findInteractingBlocks()
Check for presence of gzip and bz2 modules
Merge branch 'qc' of https://github.com/peastman/openmm into qc
Created new API for tabulated functions
Converted reference platform to process tabulated functions with the TabulatedFunction API
Converted CUDA and OpenCL platforms to process tabulated functions with the TabulatedFunction API
Delete TabulatedFunctions when their owner is deleted
Tabulated function parameters are hardcoded in the kernel instead of being stored in an array.  This makes the code simpler and may help performance slightly.
Created OpenCL and CUDA implementations of Continuous2DFunction
Fixed an error on platforms where the maximum workgroup size can vary between kernels
Created OpenCL and CUDA implementations of Continuous3DFunction
Fixed errors in wrapper generation related to TabulatedFunctions
Renamed methods for dealing with TabulatedFunctions to avoid problems in wrapper APIs.  Also fixed a few bugs.
Converted GBn and GBn2 to use discrete functions (improves performance)
ForceField supports all types of tabulated functions in CustomGBForce
Add .dms file to cmake lists to copy into build directory
Fixed a minor error in Doxygen comments
Fixed some errors in documentation generation
Another attempt at dealing with the fact that some compilers define round() and others don't
Ignore VIM swap files and backup files
Fix long-range vdW correction for real systems.
More int -> double conversions to avoid overflows on _very_ big systems in which the square of the number of particles in the dominant LJ type overflows integers.
Convert interaction counting to long long int to avoid integer overflows in CustomNonbondedForceImpl long-range correction.
Fixed incorrectly formatted comments that caused problems in the API docs
Removed unnecessary synchronization that hurt performance on Nvidia
Created a property for setting the number of CPU cores to use
Added option to explicitly set PME parameters
Created files for AMOEBA 2013 force field
only rerun when at least one test failed
Added documentation and header information for AMOEBA 2013 force field
Began creating CPU implementation of CustomNonbondedForce
Began parallelizing CPU implementation of CustomNonbondedForce
Finished parallelizing CPU implementation of CustomNonbondedForce
Fixed compilation errors on Windows  plus an error in a test case
Fixed a potential divide by zero
Fixed some bugs in addExtraParticles() that affect the CHARMM polarizable force field
changes based on responses from @swails and @jchodera
Enhance the test to ensure that the checkpoint can be loaded correctly
Added step limit for LocalEnergyMinimizer in Modeller.addHydrogens() to prevent hangs with bad structures.
Exposed getMolecules() in the public API
Install SWIG interface definition to the include directory  so outside plugins can use it when building their Python APIs
Fixed a compilation error in C wrappers
Typo fix (represnted -> represented) and remove the execution permission bit from all .cpp and .h files.
A previous commit had changed OpenMM_headers.i to OpenMMSwigHeaders.i without changing the corresponding include statement in OpenMM.i.
Disable OpenCL platform on known-buggy macs
First pass at adding my CHARMM compatibility layer.
Import the CHARMM objects into the toplevel namespace of the app layer.
Fix remaining bugs with CHARMM integration.
Add some protection against an uncaught exception in the CharmmFile destructor
Fixed bug in OpenCL implementation of GBSA on CPU devices

Update the simtk/openmm/app/charmm/__init__.py file with the MIT license and correct list of modules (the existing list was for the ParmEd implementation which separated out the OpenMM integration so not having it was not fatal).
Add a couple unittests for CHARMM files.  Good thing  too  because they helped pick up some bugs that were not caught in my initial test following the port from ParmEd.
Add support for the Amber GB forces.  Put in the correct radii determination (again  code pulled from ParmEd) and update the tests to include this.
Add the PSF files and CHARMM 22 files to the install lists (I think?? I've never really used CMake in-depth before).
Added missing serialization support for CustomNonbondedForce interaction groups.
Added missing serialization for some other properties of CustomNonbondedForce.
Updated tests of serialization of CustomNonbondedForce  though test omits comparison of interaction group sets since I couldn't figure out how to do that.
Added serialization of more properties  as well as unit test extensions for these additions.
Add a positions setter and improve the error message when someone fails to load parameters to a ProteinStructure before calling createSystem.
Added assertion utility to compare containers.
getBoolProperty() now returns bool  instead of it.
Removed code left over from debugging.
Fixed same issue in NonbondedForce serialization.
Added missing serialization of PME parameters alpha  nx  ny  nz for NonbondedForce.
Added defaults to make serialization of CustomNonbondedForce and NonbondedForce backward-compatible.
Cleanup to the recent serialization code changes
First pass at making a consistent API.
Update the CHARMM API to be consistent with the rest of OpenMM.
ValueError -> TypeError.  Seems a more appropriate exception to raise.
Correct some docstrings to reflect the updated API.
Include force groups when serializing forces

Add more file type detection in the CharmmParameterSet constructor. The current constructor _should_ be able to take all of files in the CHARMM parameter set distribution and correctly determine file type from just the name and/or filename extension.

-More changes to the API to use camelCase everywhere in the public classes. - Add a docstring to element.Element.getByMass describing what it does - Add a new element virtualsite with atomic number 0 (and alias it to extrapoint   and lonepair)
Undo the change for get_by_symbol  since Travis-CI suggests that it breaks pickleability.
Get rid of extra point element -- use "None" as no element
Fix this problem reported by Travis-CI:
Modify simulateCharmm.py to require a top and par file.  Delete charmm22 files to prevent users from actually using them.
Add the parameter/RTF files back for the examples. Put a note in simulateCharmm.py to use the latest force fields. This is what CHARMM does for their own tutorials  so this is fine.
Add the copyright and license/distribution info to the top of each new file.
Add a more sensible way to set and retrieve box vectors.
Simplify setBox -- it now takes 3 lengths and 3 angles. You can also set boxVectors directly (which is how you would do it if you set up a PDB with a CRYST1 record  for instance).
Add CHARMM coordinate file parsers (originally written by Jason Deckman and patched up by me).
Coordinates and velocities have to be natom-length iterators of Vec3's
Give users an easy way to clear the CMAP terms if they don't want to include any correction maps in their calculations.

When looking at the file names of CHARMM parameter/topology files  only look at the file name (not the path) for "top" and "par" to determine file type.  Often enough  these files are stored in a "toppar" directory  so all of them will be interpreted as RTF files.
Merge branch 'magic-bytes' of github.com:rmcgibbo/openmm into magic-bytes
Fix the mbondi radii specification (for the HCT GB model in CHARMM files).
Created CUDA and OpenCL implementations of LocalCoordinatesSite
Guard against multiple definition of M_PI
Can't send bare stringstream to iostream  use .str()
MSVC 2013 defines conformant round()  workaround not needed
serialization #defines not visible to VS2013  add manually
Force necessary settings for serialization sources  fixes compile prob on W7/MSVC12
Revert "serialization #defines not visible to VS2013  add manually"
Merge branch 'vs2013-compile-errors' of https://github.com/smikes/openmm into vs2013-compile-errors
DrudeForce was ignoring force groups (see bug 2012)
Fixed bug in app where 'useDispersionCorrection' for AMOEBA was being cast to int instead of bool.
Added AMOEBA test system and tests for ForceField fin setting up AMOEBA system.
Fixed bug using multiple devices with PME
Fixed a bug in a test case
AmoebaTorsionTorsionForce can calculate derivatives of the grid points automatically
Fixed incorrect specification of torsion-torsion terms in AMOEBA 2013 force field
Regenerated AMOEBA 2013 force field based on corrected parameter file
Merge branch 'amoeba' of https://github.com/peastman/openmm into peastman-amoeba
Optimizations to the NEON versions of round()  floor()  and ceil()
Further cleanup and optimization to NEON vector operations
Additional CMake changes to support Android
Added tip3p-fb and tip4p-fb parameter files.

Rewrite Amber inpcrd/restart file handling. Among the improvements:     - existence of velocities and box vectors is auto-detected  so       loadVelocities and loadBoxVectors are unnecessary     - recognizes NetCDF-format Amber restart files (which can be written by       tleap  sander  pmemd  and cpptraj).     - Restart files coordinate/velocity/box fields have a hard width of 12       characters and does not ensure that fields are whitespace delimited. This       commit will correctly parse (valid) Amber restart files in which a       particular coordinate is <= -100 A or >= 1000 A (not uncommon for restart       files from sander/pmemd).     - File format (ASCII vs. NetCDF) is auto-detected.
Add a natom attribute to AmberNetcdfRestart.
Add tests for Amber inpcrd file parsing.
Remove the hard-coded orthogonal box vector code in the PrmtopLoader class. Again  this will need to be done in the future anyway for general triclinic support.
Finish the last commit. Make sure the box vector calculation from the lengths and angles makes numbers exactly 0 that _should_ be zero (but aren't due to precision and round-off issues).
Get rid of some comments that I had forgotten to get rid of earlier.
Copy over all parm7 and rst7 files as well...
The natom attribute is only part of the private objects -- this should hopefully fix the remaining CI issues.
Fix comparison test in TestAmberInpcrdFile to compare sequences element by element.
Renamed files  and updated user's guide
Fix box dimensions in test prmtop
Remove a context manager to improve compatibility with older versions of scipy.
Small tweak to fix parsing of par_all36_carb.prm ... not sure why this file is different from _all_ of the others.

Fix the handling and units of box lengths (they are not independent from boxVectors  so they should be a property computed from the vectors). Also make sure that any attempts to change the boxVectors correspondingly deletes the cached copies of the box lengths so they are recomputed if necessary.

Make separate lists for dihedrals and the dihedrals with loaded parameters.  The former has a single entry for all unique dihedrals. The latter has a separate entry for every _term_ of every dihedral (and the latter is the one with the parameters loaded into it). This way  parameter sets can be reloaded at will without relying on the hack that createSystem previously employed (i.e.  backing up the dihedral array  clobbering it  then putting it back). This way is cleaner and safer (although functionally equivalent for typical OpenMM use).
Fixed bug when multiple virtual sites depend on the same particles (see bug 2019)
Fixed a crash with virtual sites in double precision mode
Where did this input.inpcrd file come from?  There was an extra space between the 3rd and 4th columns  making it an invalid Amber inpcrd file (which the new parser cannot handle).
Improve unit handling in charmm crd file classes.
Made ordering of improper torsions more consistent.  Also fixed a bug related to Drude particles.
Added documentation for using a CustomNonbondedForce in force fields.  Also updated documentation on how to specify a tabulated function.
Make sure that calling createExclusionsFromBonds() with bondCutoff=0 never adds exclusions
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/SimTk/openmm into exclusions
Reverted a change that is no longer necessary
Fixed an error in the computation of Drude screening force
GromacsTopFile adds exclusions based on [ exclusions ] directives
Fix PSF parser in cases where single residues are differentiated by their system (which means that consecutive residues may have the same residue number _and_ name  but are different residues).
XmlSerializer generates XML directly rather than going through TinyXml
Fix Clang warning about unhandled enum values.
Committed updated Makefile and doxyfile.  (These don't need to be in here.)
Removed 'void' declarations from getCutoff/getCutoffDistance methods so that swigInputBuilder.py would correctly wrap return values.
Added dispersion correction flag handling to NonbondedGenerator.
Fixed a rare memory corruption error when roundoff causes tile indices to be wrong
Commented out testEinsteinCrystal()  since it failed much too often
Speed up a slow test case by using a smaller topology file
Changed travis script to run Python tests in parallel
Define value included one extra leading character
Use a newer version of nose in travis script
Added a test case to make sure future changes to ForceField do not change forces
Made test case more tolerant of numerical differences between platforms
Began creating API for programmatically building and editing ForceFields

Small fixes:     - Adjust CharmmPsfFile parser to accept multiple blank lines before the       NATOM record (I saw 1 PSF file like this... not sure how common it really       is)     - Removed the shebang line from element.py and removed execute permissions--       it should never be executed directly (evidenced by the fact that the       original shebang line was wrong and would never work  anyway).     - Fix a test to determine if a Bond is part of an Angle in the PSF data       structures.
Added start of automated conda packaging of openmm-dev.
Updated preinstall script with more prereqs.
Fixed conda build.sh to build current source version  rather than online version.
Updated build.sh to change to source directory first.
Fixed binstar token  updated directory to run nosetests.
Disabled python 3.3 in build matrix because it didn't seem to be working yet.
Added prerequisites for OpenCL build from PR #501
Updated conda build script to get more understandable errors.
Testing what happens if I comment out OpenCL library path.
Restored parallel conda build  attempting to add C tests.
Now try to install OpenMM tests as well (though these may need to be placed in a subdirectory or have `OpenMM` inserted into their names). Also try to get more debug information to make C tests run.
It seems jinja2 is required now.
Fixed error in testing block of meta.yaml
New testing strategy: Move tests into build.sh
Added nose requirement to conda build requirements to enable Python testing.
Added numpy to build requirements (for testing) and set OPENMM_PLUGIN_DIR to enable locating imports.
Moved Python tests to be run after conda build/install.
Changed platform used in UTF-8 test.
Removed debug code from UTF-8 test to clean up.
Fixed error in copy of test files.
Fix a bug in which the switching function would not get toggled if requested via the switchDistance argument to CharmmPsfFile.createSystem().
Switched compiler to clang++ in travis-ci
Added comment for OpenCL test exclusion in conda recipe build.sh
Fix lepton size_t VS2013 warnings by casting to int.
Created option so virtual sites can share the exclusions of their parent

Move prmtop instantiation outside of the setUp routine and put it in the module itself. This way each parm is only read once for every test (rather than being read for every test  even when they're not used  as part of the setUp routine). For large systems  this makes the tests run a lot faster (for small systems it's not a large speedup).

Add NBFIX support to the Amber topology file parsers.  The new Amber ff14IPQ force field utilizes nbfix functionality. Without this commit  using a ff14IPQ topology file (or one modified by ParmEd to contain off-diagonal LJ elements)  would happily run  but ignore off-diagonal elements.
Force the test to use the Reference platform (it's a tiny system  and all TestAmberPrmtopFile.py tests take 17 seconds combined on my laptop).
Fix error reporting in a corner case.  Looks like a case of incomplete copy-and-paste...
Remove extra files to save disk space
Build conda recipe regardless of test success.
Updated long range correction code to work with new style tabulated functions
Changed definition of polarizability to match CHARMM
Created XML file for CHARMM polarizable force field
Added CHARMM polarizable force field to the list of force fields in the manual
Trivial change to force travis to rerun the tests

Change the default so that NBFIX amber topology files use a long-range correction by default. Then add a test for using the long-range correction and _not_ using the long-range correction.  Comment out the test using the long-range correction since it currently segfaults.  When the fix for the segfault is added  this test can be reinstated (but the energy has to be updated)
Update the energy in anticipation of just uncommenting that test when the fix is added.
Depressing compromise to make the ordering of atoms in improper torsions as consistent as possible with both AMBER and CHARMM
Add a test for the 12-6-4 potential.

Add an explicit (shallow) copy constructor for CustomNonbondedForce. This fixes segfaults when you use the long-range dispersion correction with the CustomNonbondedForce if the force uses TabulatedFunction objects. Basically  it prevents the copy from taking ownership (and deleting) the functions in its destructor.
Fixed bug when running on a CPU device
Revert to older Travis-CI testing framework so we can separate testing from conda dev builds.

- Some minor cleanups and simplifications in the Amber prmtop parser. - Convert coordinates  velocities  and box vectors into Vec3 objects to avoid a   subtle bug in the units module with respect to silently modifying mutable   collections in-place when converting to a new set of units.
Fixed a bug in unit conversion for sequences
Switch to a deep copy on the tabulated functions in CustomNonbondedForce. This necessitated creating a Copy method to do that on TabulatedFunction classes.
Created reference implementation of DIIS for converging AMOEBA dipoles.  Also some minor code cleanup.
- Make the TabulatedFunction::Copy method a pure virtual. - Don't make a Copy method on FunctionInfo - Have the Copy() methods on the TabulatedFunction subclasses return a pointer
Add a comment about updating the copy constructor if the implementation details are changed for CustomNonbondedForce.
Make sure inpcrd files are copied to the build directory.
Implement NBFIX in the CHARMM parsers.
Pass the custom force particle as a tuple of 1 parameter  rather than just as a single parameter.
Add a test for CHARMM NBFIX and import CharmmPSFWarning into the simtk.openmm.app namespace to allow users to filter that warning out if they want to.
Make sure the necessary files get copied over.
Make sure the parameter file gets copied over.
Remove hardcoded reference to my fork in build_conda_package_vagrant.sh
Created CMake targets for building Sphinx documentation
Marked Sphinx-generated PDF files as optional installs
Fixed error in OpenCL MonteCarloBarostat in double precision
Preliminary support for Chrome portable native client
Disable OpenCL by default on Macs
Consolidated logic for determining if vector instructions are supported
Created PNaCl implementation of vector instructions (not yet optimized!)
Modified test case to work on ARM
Fixed error when running in double precision
Fix crash with empty interaction groups
Merge branch 'pnacl' of https://github.com/peastman/openmm into pnacl
Fixed lots of errors in User Guide  especially in equations
Fixed compilation error on some compilers
Added discussion of loading CHARMM files
Edits to documentation based on Jason's comments
Fix possible problems when parsing some CHARMM stream files that may not have the same format as the rest of the CHARMM stream files I've seen.
Redo the way CHARMM PSF files are parsed.  This should be much more robust in terms of supporting PSF files that don't really conform to the "standard" way that CHARMM prints them.

Prevent sphinx from adding an index to PDF file

Avoid integer overflow when dealing with very large systems

Updated Context::getParameter() and Context::setParameter() error messages to also print name of incorrect parameter to aid debugging.
